localcopy.rightLabel: Enable file copy of standard files
helpers: Rather than using FTP simply copy the standard web files to another folder.
Typically this would be used when 'self hosting', when FTP would not be appropriate/efficient.
It can be used in conjunction with FTP.

localcopyfolder.label: Local copy destination folder path:
localcopyfolder.helper: Enter the folder name to which you wish to copy the standard files, this should have a trailing '/' or '\'

sslftp.label: Select the FTP Protocol to use:
sslftp.helper: Select the protocol required by your web host

ftpport.label: FTP port:
helpers: Enter the FTP port to use. Common defaults are: FTP=21, FTPS=21(990*), SFTP=22
* Port 990 is used when the older Implicit FTPS is configured

sshAuth.label: SFTP Authentication method:
sshAuth.helper: Select the authentication method for SFTP connections

stdwebsite.rightLabel: I want to use the supplied default web site
helpers: WARNING: Ticking this WILL overwrite any existing settings you may have saved, if you set this, please double check all your settings below
Enabling this will automatically enable all the required options below
Disabling this WILL automatically DISABLE all the required options below
You will still need to save the configuration after setting this option
This switch setting is not saved, it is just a switch to configure the defaults for the standard web site. It overwrites any settings you may already have set

helpers: Select which standard files are to be created uploaded every update interval
Note the websiteinfo.json file is required for the default web site and is uploaded once or when the station configuration is changed
Note the wxnow.txt file is created every minute, regardless of your web interval

server.helper: The hostname (and domain) or IP address of your SMTP server

port.label: Network Port:
port.helper: The SMTP port used by your SMTP server

ssloption.label: Use SSL/TLS:
helpers: Select the protocol required by your email server:
None - No SSL or TLS encryption will be used
Auto - Cumulus decides which TLS/unencrypted options to use (default). Use this option unless you have good reason not to
TlsOnConnect - The connection should use TLS encryption immediately
StartTls - Use TLS encryption immediately. If the server does not support the STARTTLS extension then the connection will fail
StartTlsWhenAvailable - use TLS encryption immediately, but only if the server supports the STARTTLS extension

ignorecerterrors.label: Certificate errors:
ignorecerterrors.helper: Caution: Forces the email client to ignore any errors when checking the servers security certificate, this is not normally required
